messages.message: A number of our enterprise customers are asking about the ability to choose between using OpenAI, Gemini, Anthrophic, etc. To objection handle this point, we always say that we benchmark across these models and we find that OpenAI performs the best in terms of both accuracy and performance. Renre is now asking to see this data - is there any data that we can share on this @lydia @Kaustubh (KD)? cc: @Tom @Orlando @Akshay

We don't have any recent numbers. We last benchmarked Anthropic ~ 8 months ago, and considering their recent model releases, that is probably pretty outdated.

I can work with the model dev team to prioritize this soon. Let me chat with @Nikolaos Kofinas to get a sense of effort.

I thought a big part of why we only offer OpenAI is also the privacy terms and the quota/rate limits we've negotiated.

There may also be differences in API features that prevent us from seamlessly switching (I'll circle back on this).

It sounds like this is not a heavy lift on the eng side. The main blocker is getting accounts set up / quota with these other providers. @hannah who can we work with to get a list of competitors to benchmark and API keys with appropriate quota?
@lydia @hannah Can we get a discussion on the doc types we test and benchmark on?
The bench marks are something that customer would be interested in seeing the results of

Our benchmarks are intended to help us monitor regression in model performance, and decide between algorithms / models. I wouldn't share the results with customers because the actual numbers are not relevant to them. Rather, we look at the relative difference when making modeling decisions, but the absolute numbers are specific to the dataset in our benchmark, and not reflective of what customers would see on their datasets.

@Kaustubh (KD) can you please work with @lydia on this? We would need to be able to share aggregate level findings with customers to provide confidence that our selection of OpenAI provides them with the best model.
Yeah I think that’s a good idea, we don’t need details. But high level finding on some paper we can stand behind to close out the concerns
